notes.text:
An update for kernel-rt is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel-rt packages provide the Real Time Linux Kernel, which enables fine-tuning for systems with extremely high determinism requirements.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: net/sched: cls_u32 component reference counter leak if tcf_change_indev() fails (CVE-2023-3609)

* kernel: tun: bugs for oversize packet when napi frags enabled in tun_napi_alloc_frags (CVE-2023-3812)

* kernel: net/sched: Use-after-free vulnerabilities in the net/sched classifiers: cls_fw, cls_u32 and cls_route (CVE-2023-4128, CVE-2023-4206, CVE-2023-4207, CVE-2023-4208)

* kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe (CVE-2023-5178)

* kernel: netfilter: potential slab-out-of-bound access due to integer underflow (CVE-2023-42753)

* kernel: AMD: Cross-Thread Return Address Predictions (CVE-2022-27672)

* hw: Intel: Gather Data Sampling (GDS) side channel vulnerability (CVE-2022-40982)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in HW. When SMT is enabled, certain AMD processors may speculatively execute instructions using a target from the sibling thread after an SMT mode switch, potentially resulting in information disclosure.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: AMD: Cross-Thread Return Address Predictions
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9 are not affected if spectre_v2 mitigation enabled (and it is enabled by default).
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

The current mitigations for spectre V4 (or spectre_v2) should mitigate this flaw, no additional steps will need to be taken.

In more details, according to the article 
https://kernel.org/doc/html//next/admin-guide/hw-vuln/cross-thread-rsb.html

Two mitigations are needed:

1) Stuff the RSB during context switch which is already being done in RHEL8/RHEL9 as long as the spectre_v2 mitigation is active.
2) For KVM, the mitigation for the KVM_CAP_X86_DISABLE_EXITS capability can be turned on using the boolean module parameter mitigate_smt_rsb, e.g. vm.mitigate_smt_rsb=1.

The command to check if mitigation is active:
cat /sys/devices/system/cpu/vulnerabilities/spectre_v2

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: AMD: Cross-Thread Return Address Predictions

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A Gather Data Sampling (GDS) transient execution side-channel vulnerability was found affecting certain Intel processors. This issue may allow a local attacker using gather instruction (load from memory) to infer stale data from previously used vector registers on the same physical core.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: hw: Intel: Gather Data Sampling (GDS) side channel vulnerability
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
The vulnerability can be mitigated by installing the CPU microcode package microcode_ctl version 20230808.

vulnerabilities.title: hw: Intel: Gather Data Sampling (GDS) side channel vulnerability

notes.text: A double-free flaw was found in u32_set_parms in net/sched/cls_u32.c in the Network Scheduler component in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to use a failure event to mishandle the reference counter, leading to a local privilege escalation threat.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: net/sched: cls_u32 component reference counter leak if tcf_change_indev() fails
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
To mitigate this issue, prevent module cls_u32 from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: net/sched: cls_u32 component reference counter leak if tcf_change_indev() fails

notes.text: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâs TUN/TAP device driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big) networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

To mitigate this issue, prevent the tun module from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.

notes.text: This record is a duplicate of CVE-2023-4206, CVE-2023-4207, and CVE-2023-4208. Do not use this CVE record: CVE-2023-4128.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: All CVE users should reference CVE-2023-4206, CVE-2023-4207, CVE-2023-4208 instead of this record. All references and descriptions in this record have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: net/sched: Use-after-free vulnerabilities in the net/sched classifiers: cls_fw, cls_u32 and cls_route

notes.text:
There are 3 CVEs for the use-after-free flaw found in net/sched/cls_fw.c in classifiers (cls_fw, cls_u32, and cls_route) in the Linux Kernel: CVE-2023-4206, CVE-2023-4207, CVE-2023-4208. 
A local user could use any of these flaws to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

Similar CVE-2023-4128 was rejected as a duplicate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: net/sched: Use-after-free vulnerabilities in the net/sched classifiers: cls_fw, cls_u32 and cls_route
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, prevent the module cls_u32 from being loaded by blacklisting the module to prevent it from loading automatically. 
~~~
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 
~~~

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in `nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe/TCP subsystem in the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a use-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote code execution or lead to local privilege escalation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is actual only for systems where NVME over TCP being used.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe

notes.text: An array indexing vulnerability was found in the netfilter subsystem of the Linux kernel. A missing macro could lead to a miscalculation of the `h->nets` array offset, providing attackers with the primitive to arbitrarily increment/decrement a memory buffer out-of-bound. This issue may allow a local user to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update the affected package as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: netfilter: potential slab-out-of-bound access due to integer underflow
